p: Furthermore results regarding NORT of ex vivo %DPPH free radicals scavenging activity in cortex and hippocampus of different animals groups are presented in Figure 8C,D. %DPPH inhibition activity in the cortex and hippocampus of scopolamine-treated groups were significantly (**: p < 0.01) lower (14.6 + 0.2 and 19.4 + 0.5) as compared to normal saline group (44.6 + 0.3 and 58.0 + 0.4.). Fa.EtAc + Scop (50 mg/kg, p.o.), Fa.EtAc + Scop (100 mg/kg, p.o.), and Fa.EtAc + Scop (200 mg/kg, p.o.) and standard donepezil-treated groups showed significantly higher %anti-radicals activities of 24.6 + 0.1 #, 31.6 + 0.5 ##, 38.2 + 0.4 ##, and 49.4 + 0.1 ### in cortex and 33.6 + 0.5 #, 51.4 + 0.5 ##, 56.8 + 0.2 ##, and 62.0 + 0.3 ## in the hippocampus, respectively.
